# It is defined by the kaggle/python docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the "../input/" directory.
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# Any results you write to the current directory are saved as output.

pd.set_option('display.max_columns', None)  
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as mpatches
%matplotlib inline 
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.io as pio
import plotly.graph_objects as go
from plotly.offline import init_notebook_mode, iplot
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
source.c7c39b32:
df = df[df["Year_of_Release"].notnull()]
df = df[df["Genre"].notnull()]
df = df[df["Publisher"].notnull()]
df['Year_of_Release']=df['Year_of_Release'].astype('int64')
df['User_Score']=df['User_Score'].replace('tbd',0).astype('float64')
source.94a61ac9:
sns.set_style("whitegrid")
trace1=go.Scatter(
                x=df.groupby(['Genre']).mean().reset_index()['Genre'], 
                y=df.groupby(['Genre']).mean().reset_index()['NA_Sales'],
                mode='lines+markers',
                name='North America Sales',
                marker = dict(size=8),
                line=dict(color = '#FA8072',width=2.5))
trace2=go.Scatter(
                x=df.groupby(['Genre']).mean().reset_index()['Genre'], 
                y=df.groupby(['Genre']).mean().reset_index()['EU_Sales'],
                mode='lines+markers',
                name='Europe Sales',
                marker = dict(size=8),
                line=dict(color = '#6495ED',width=2.5))

trace3=go.Scatter(
                x=df.groupby(['Genre']).mean().reset_index()['Genre'], 
                y=df.groupby(['Genre']).mean().reset_index()['JP_Sales'],
                mode='lines+markers',
                name='Japan Sales',
                marker = dict(size=8),
                line=dict(color = 'yellowgreen',width=2.5))

trace4=go.Scatter(
                x=df.groupby(['Genre']).mean().reset_index()['Genre'], 
                y=df.groupby(['Genre']).mean().reset_index()['Other_Sales'],
                mode='lines+markers',
                name='Other Country Sales',
                marker = dict(size=8),
                line=dict(color = '#DAA520',width=2.5))

edit_df=[trace1,trace2,trace3,trace4]
layout=dict(
            legend=dict(x=0.77, y=1.2, font=dict(size=10)), legend_orientation="v",
            title="Average Sales of Different Genre Games",
            xaxis=dict(title="Genre",tickfont=dict(size=8.35),zeroline=False,gridcolor="white"),
            yaxis=dict(title='Average Sales in Different Countries',gridcolor="#DCDCDC"),
            plot_bgcolor='white')


fig=dict(data=edit_df,layout=layout)
iplot(fig)
source.6942c45d:
fig=plt.figure(figsize=(29,14))
plt.subplots_adjust(left=0.25, wspace=0.20, hspace=0.35)
sns.set_style("white")

plt.subplot(2, 2, 1)
plt.title('Gross Sales of Different Genre Games in Europe',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
plt.xticks(fontsize=14)
plt.yticks(fontsize=14)
sns.barplot(y='Genre', x='EU_Sales', data=df.groupby('Genre').sum().EU_Sales.sort_values(ascending=False).reset_index(),palette='YlOrRd_r');
plt.ylabel('Genre',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
plt.xlabel('Sales in Europe',fontdict={'fontsize':16})

plt.subplot(2, 2, 2)
plt.xticks(fontsize=14)
plt.yticks(fontsize=14)
plt.title('Gross Sales of Different Genre Games in North America',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
sns.barplot(y='Genre', x='NA_Sales', data=df.groupby('Genre').sum().NA_Sales.sort_values(ascending=False).reset_index(),palette='YlOrRd_r');
plt.ylabel('',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
plt.xlabel('Sales in North America',fontdict={'fontsize':16})

plt.subplot(2, 2, 3)
plt.xticks(fontsize=14)
plt.yticks(fontsize=14)
plt.title('Gross Sales of Different Genre Games in Japan',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
sns.barplot(y='Genre', x='JP_Sales', data=df.groupby('Genre').sum().JP_Sales.sort_values(ascending=False).reset_index(),palette='YlOrRd_r');
plt.ylabel('Genre',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
plt.xlabel('Sales in Japan',fontdict={'fontsize':16})


plt.subplot(2, 2, 4)
plt.xticks(fontsize=14)
plt.yticks(fontsize=14)
plt.title('Gross Sales of Different Genre Games in Other Countries',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
sns.barplot(y='Genre', x='Other_Sales', data=df.groupby('Genre').sum().Other_Sales.sort_values(ascending=False).reset_index(),palette='YlOrRd_r');
plt.ylabel('',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
plt.xlabel('Sales in Other Countries',fontdict={'fontsize':16})

fig=plt.figure(figsize=(24.5,22))
plt.subplot2grid((3,1), (1,0))
sns.set_style("white")
plt.xticks(fontsize=14)
plt.yticks(fontsize=14)
plt.title('Gross Global Sales of Different Genre Games',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
sns.barplot(y='Genre', x='Global_Sales', data=df.groupby('Genre').sum().Global_Sales.sort_values(ascending=False).reset_index(),palette='YlOrRd_r');
plt.ylabel('Genre',fontdict={'fontsize':16})
plt.xlabel('Global Sales',fontdict={'fontsize':16});

sns.set_style("whitegrid")
fig=plt.figure(figsize=(23.5,10))
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
colo='yellowgreen'
plt.title('Sales of Games in Different Countries over the Years',fontdict={'fontsize':14})
for i in range(0,len(df[['NA_Sales','EU_Sales','JP_Sales','Other_Sales']].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).index)):
    sns.pointplot(x='Year_of_Release',y=df[['NA_Sales','EU_Sales','JP_Sales','Other_Sales']].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).index[i],data=df.groupby(df['Year_of_Release'].sort_values()).sum().drop(['Year_of_Release'],axis=1).reset_index(),color=colo)
    i=i+1
    colo='grey'

plt.legend(handles=[mpatches.Patch(color='yellowgreen', label=df[['NA_Sales','EU_Sales','JP_Sales','Other_Sales']].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).index[0]),
                       mpatches.Patch(color='grey', label=df[['NA_Sales','EU_Sales','JP_Sales','Other_Sales']].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).index[1]),
                       mpatches.Patch(color='grey', label=df[['NA_Sales','EU_Sales','JP_Sales','Other_Sales']].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).index[2]),
                       mpatches.Patch(color='grey', label=df[['NA_Sales','EU_Sales','JP_Sales','Other_Sales']].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).index[3])], loc='upper left', fontsize = 12)    

plt.ylabel('Gross Sales in Different Countries',fontdict={'fontsize':13})
plt.xlabel('Year of Release',fontdict={'fontsize':13});

source.20d9ae95: *Well.. Yes, the Number of Releases and the Global Sales made over the years are correlated, as we could clearly see that, when the number of games increases, the Global sales increases.*
source.6e581dc7:
*With respect to Publishers, Nintendo was the publisher who has released the higest number of games and also made the Highest Global sales in the 20th Century*

*In the 21st century, Electronic Arts has the higest number of releases and Nintendo has the Highest global sales.*
source.9e97a39c: *Let's analyze the Gross Sales of Video games across different regions of the world over the years.*
source.274192d1: *Wii Sports developed and published by Nintendo in the year 2006 is best-selling video game of all time even outselling the Super Mario Bros.   *
source.4021f752:
*Mario has come a long way. Over the last 30 years Mario has appeared in more than 200 video games and has been referenced in hundreds more Nintendo and non-Nintendo titles. 
The Super Mario Bros. movie was the first movie based on a video game. *
source.3fd38f7f:
*Nintendo has made the Highest Global Sales, Higest sales in North America, Europe and Japan, whereas Electronic Ars has made the higest Sales in the rest of the World.*  

![Nintendo-logo-red.png](attachment:Nintendo-logo-red.png)

*Nintendo is one of the oldest and most beloved companies around. Nintendo revolutionized the gaming industry several times over through controllers that constantly introduced new features to mass markets.  
Nintendo's Game Boy was the first video game console to be played in space.*
source.a2b90351: *Electronic Arts Inc. (EA) is one of the world’s leading publishers of video and computer games software. EA built sophisticated computer systems to begin tracking customers' behavior, from their purchasing decisions to how they played games. The amount of information was astronomical. Today, EA collects more data in 24 hours than the US Library of Congress has in its entire archives. And currently, EA has more than 300 million registered players around the world.*
source.a978339b:
*The Video Games industry is the wealthiest of all entertainment industries. 
Every day 25 new games are released on Steam.*

*Lets analyze the Top selling Games across the World including the User and Critic Score analysis.*
source.b9b0b661:
*We could see that Nintendo is the Publisher who has made the Highest Global Sales most of the years.*

![Nintendo-logo-red.png](attachment:Nintendo-logo-red.png)

*Nintendo is a Japanese company that began as a playing card manufacturer in 1889, released a number of important video game franchises still around today, such as Super Mario Bros., The Legend of Zelda, and Metroid.  
Nintendo won Emmy awards for "game controller innovation" for its Wii and DS systems.*
source.e2d30189:
*A video game console is a machine that is used to play video games which has Special controllers are attached to the console to control the game. *

*Modern video game consoles are all-in-one entertainment machines that offer you the ability to not just play games but to watch movies, log onto Facebook, turn on your television, and engage in a whole host of other built-in benefits to make your gaming experience better. *

*In 1991, Nintendo released its 16-bit Super NES console in North America, launching the first real “console war.”*
source.fbfba9c9:
*Dreamcast is the Gaming platform which has the Highest User scores and Critic scores.*

*The Dreamcast is a home video game console released by Sega which was the first console which allowed real-time online play feature and was the first ever games console to have motion controllers.*
source.0035f6ed: *Let's analyze the Sales of different Platform Games across different regions of the World.*
source.b1e11be0: *Let's analyze the Average User scores and Average Critic scores of different Platform Games.*
source.fe1966de:
*Again, Action Genre has higest number of games released over the years.*

*In a study, published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, a team used a pattern discrimination task to compare action video game players' visual performance with that of individuals who do not play action video games. The action-gamers outperformed the non-action gamers. The key to the action-gamers success, the researchers found, was that their brains used a better template for the task at hand.*
source.e119199d: *Breath of Fire III is the game with Higest User Score and User count.*
source.adabcb92: *Let's analyze Top Selling Game of every year using a hover-over bar chart.*
source.264abfd5: *We could see that Wii-Sports have made the Highest Sales in North America and Europe, whereas Pokemon Red/Pokemon Blue has made the highest sales in Japan and Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas in the rest of the world.*
source.b2494310: *Again, Electronic Arts Games has the Highest User scores and Critic scores.*
source.1d6acf5d: *Lets just drop the null values from the Year_of_Release, Genre and Publisher columns for now.*
source.0f44a753: *We could see that the Wii-Sports from the Year 2006 is the highest selling game of all time.*
source.bfdcc087: *Let's just write a small piece of code to differentiate the region with Hihgest global sales of Video games from the rest.*
source.dacfecac: *Super Mario Bros. is the Higest selling game of 20th Century.*
source.5f6ebd29:
*The history of video gaming can be traced back to 1952.
Video games transformed from a little known hobby into a multi-billion dollar industry in the US during the 20th century.*

*Let's analyze the differences between the 20th Century and the 21st Century Gaming.*
source.dd80d717: *Let's analyze Top Publisher Game of every year with the Highest Global Sales using a hover-over bar chart.*
source.09480d53:
*We could see that Xbox-360 is the console that have the higest selling games in North America, Nintendo DS in Japan, PS2 in Europe and other regions of the World.*

*The interesting fact here is, the console that have the higest selling games in North America is the least in Japan.    
Japanese Gamers are unique..!!*
source.64ccbdaf:
*We could see that the higest Global Sales have been made in the Year 2008 and the most number of Games released is also in the same year.*

*It looks like the Number of Games released and the Global Sales made over the years are correlated.*

*Lets analyze the same..*
source.50f04705:
*Wii Sports is a collection of five sports simulations, designed to demonstrate the motion-sensing capabilities of the Wii Remote.   
The five sports included are tennis, baseball, bowling, golf and boxing.  
Players use the Wii Remote to mimic actions performed in real-life sports, such as swinging a tennis racket.  
The motion sensor technology is what made the Nintendo Wii so popular.*
source.225a64e3:
*Action Games are the higest sold games around the World except in Japan, where Role-Playing games make the higest sales. *

*Playing Action Games improves  perceptual decision making, or the ability to identify and select targets, Speed of processing, or how quickly one can respond to a target.*
source.a80c842d:
*What do Gamers love the most?   
Gaming..!!*

*But, What else do they enjoy?   
The Analysis of the Video Games Industry..!!   *

*There are 2.3 billion gamers in the world. The love they have for Video Games is infinite, just like the Universe !!  One of the most addictive things the Gamers do, is sit and read about video games, especially the history and interesting facts behind some of their Favorite Titles, or Gaming Publishers, or Game Developers – it is all so interesting how it came together.*

*Video games have evolved over the years to offer players almost any type of experience. This Video Games data is an extended version of Gregory Smith's web scrape of VGChartz Video Games Sales which contains the list of video games with sales greater than 100,000 copies.*

*Let us analyze some of the interesting facts about the Video Games Industry, and ofcourse the Sales of the Video Games.*

*We will perform this Analysis based on various aspects of Gaming such as Sales, Year of Release, Genre, Platform, Publisher of the Game, User Scores and Critic Scores by using Python's data visualization libraries - Matplotlib, Seaborn and Plotly.*
source.87666dec: *Although the overall Global sales have increased drastically in the 21st century when compared to 21st Century, the Sales in Japan has increased only a little in the 21st Century when compared to the 20th Century. This is because, that the Gaming Industry in Japan started its expansion only in the later 20th Century.*
source.6d846e6b:
*Video games have been around since the early 1970s. The evolution of video game systems only took more or less 30 years to get where it is now.
Video games today are even equipped with modems to let them connect to the internet and play with other people from all over the world.   
The above image shows how the character Super Mario has evolved over the years.*

*Lets analyze the Average and Gross Sales of Video games and the Number of Games released and also the Top Games and Top publishers with Higest Global Sales every year.*
source.a29c054d: *Now, let's analyze the relationship between the Number of Releases and Global Sales of Games under each Plaform.*
source.5b8ab043:
*A video game publisher is a company that publishes video games that have been developed either internally by the publisher or externally by a video game developer.*

*Lets analyze the Top publishers with the Number of games published, Gross/Average sales and User/critic Scores.*
source.e1bb03c6: *Electronic Arts is the publisher which released the highest number of games of all time.*
source.7b5638f7:
*Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is an action-adventure video game developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games is known around the world as being one of the biggest gaming franchises ever.  
The Guinness World Records 2009 Gamer's Edition lists it as the most successful PlayStation 2 game, with 17.33 million copies sold for that console alone, from a total of 21.5 million in all formats.  
By the way, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas  was one of my favourite game during my school days.*
source.f0c6ad91: *Though it looks like there is some kind of positive correlation between the Number of releases and the Global Sales, Consoles like NES have negative correlation, where the Number of games is less, but the Global sales is high. Similarly, Consoles like PSP have negative correlation, where the Number of games is high, but the Global sales is low. Few such platforms too have negative correlation.*
source.871fb6bc: *The DS line of Nintendo handhelds is a monster. Not only is it the best-selling handheld gaming system of all time, it's the second-best-selling video game system period of all time.*
source.647fc00f: *PlayStation 2 is the platform that holds the Higest number of Games released and also the Higest Global sales.*
source.7969e764:
*Sports Genre has the higest number of games released in the 20th Century, whereas Action Genre has the higest number of games released in the 21st Century.*

*Platform Genre has the Higest selling games in the 20th Century, whereas Action Genre has the Higest selling games in the 21st Century.*
source.a58169c1:
## *Genre of the Game*

![Untitled-min.png](attachment:Untitled-min.png)



*Video game genre is a classification assigned to a video game based on its gameplay interaction rather than visual or narrative differences.*

*Currently, there are over 30 different types of video games, including programming games like CodinGame, where players must use programming languages like Java and C++ to advance through the levels. *

*Lets analyze the Average and Gross Sales of Video games and the Number of Games released in each Genre.*
source.30f84d20: *We could see that North America holds the Higest Average Global Sales for most of the Genre Games except for Role-Playing Genre games for which Japan holds the Higest Average Global Sales.*
source.c2278533:
*PlayStation is the console which has the Higest selling games in the 20th Century, whereas PlayStation 2 is the console which has the Higest selling games in the 21st Century.*

*PlayStation is the console which has the higest number of games in the 20th Century, whereas DS is the console which has the higest number of games in the 21st Century.*
source.4a873264:
![1200px-PlayStation_2_logo.svg.png](attachment:1200px-PlayStation_2_logo.svg.png)

*The PlayStation 2 is the best selling video game console of all time, selling over 155 million units.*

*More than 3,874 video games have been released for the PS2 since launch, and more than 1.5 billion copies of games have been sold.*
source.7a7e5150: *And.. Yes, When we look at the rest of the World, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is the highest selling game of all time.*
source.9595694a: *Grand Theft Auto IV is the game with Higest Critic Score and Critic count.*
source.c3928cf9:
*Pokémon, electronic game series from Nintendo that debuted in Japan in February 1996 as Pokémon Green and Pokémon Red. Pokémon became one of the most successful video game franchises in the world, second only to Nintendo’s Super Mario Bros.*

*From the beginning of our analysis Japan is unique in every aspect of Gaming such as the Games they play, Genre and even the Platforms.*

*Japan has always been a technological leader, particularly when it comes to gaming. *

*When it comes to Japan the games they make are much like their respective cultures.*

*While many American and European players say that Japanese titles are too vibrant and cartoonish, the majority of Japanese gamers wonder why Western games always have to be realistic and dark.*
source.33ba9496:
### *Finally..*
*Video games engulf our very core with gameplay that mystifies us, stories that thrill and amaze us and characters that live forever in our memory.  
Frequent gamers feel that video games provide more value for their money 47% compared to DVDs 28% and Music 12%.  
Players preoccupied with indulging in overeating, smoking, or drinking might be best served by reaching for a controller instead.  *

*There are 150 million Americans who play video games, making the U.S. video game industry one of the nation’s fastest-growing economic sectors. The industry provides more than 220,000 jobs in communities across all 50 states, and more than 500 colleges and universities across 46 states offer programs or degrees related to video games.*
